text: Hi, I am unable to verify my company's domain for the Oauth app, we have already added the HubSpot record to our dns service. Does anyone has idea what could be the issue?
-*contact HubSpot support- would be my idea.*
that just points to a doc on how to verify the domain - it has no contact information
<@U04FJ79G6AF> we had a domain that took forever to verify just yesterday. If you can do a dns search and it shows up right, eventually HubSpot will proccess it.
I think this is only for marketing emails rather than sales ones too. I’ll take a look though, thanks
<@U039FTRBQ93> Thanks for that tip! Looks like it is not reflecting in a dns search so I will check with my IT team
I am facing the same issue. Can anyone please help. Thanks

Hi all :) Maybe you can help me. In my company we plan to use HubSpot email forms. They don't want to use embedded scripts in our site. They want to use api when submit data to a form: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3_authentication#:~:text=As%20this%20API%20is%20authenticated%2C> I want to create a private app, read docs and everything is clear except one thing. I need to define permissions (scopes) for private app. When we use token we want to be sure that we have only permission to work with email forms. Does anyone have experience with choosing permission only for submit data to a form ?
I’m going to test that out with Dom PDF and see how that goes

I want to add api key in workflow web-hook,
But it is show same not in encrypted
What api are you trying to authenticate with?

hello folks, i’ve been stuck with this problem and was hoping someone here could help me out:

*goal:* access all of the custom object values in our CRM

*problem:* I can see access metadata about the custom object itself by using <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects|this endpoint>, but I can’t see the actual values across all companies in our CRM. for example, the custom object could be ‘brand feedback’, and i can see the object ID, etc. but not the actual values for each brand.

how can i get the actual custom object values? thanks in advance!

Hey, did you try list/read/batch read/search endpoints from the docs you linked (providing properties you are interested in)?
E.g.:
curl --request GET \
  --url '<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/your_custom_object?limit=100&properties=property_1&properties=property_2&archived=false>' \
  --header 'authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN'
Yep, notice how <@U04DUMWKMGU> uses the `properties` parameter in the url
if you're using the search endpoint you'll submit the properties in the body of the request

Hey, as stated on HS pages starting November 30, 2022 HS is sunsetting the hapi keys. I guess HS simply sunsetted your hapi key during last week thus you see that screen now. You can try to make an API call using the hapi key and see if it fails (I assume that it will fail). If it fails you have your answer (other integrations are failing as well). If it doesn't fail you can try two things:
• Go to this page (put rour portal id): <https://app.HubSpot.com/api-key/your_portal_id/call-log> (if the page from your screenshot isn't this one)
• Try to make an API call with your hapi key: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/check-daily-api-usage>
    ◦ curl --location --request GET '<https://api.hubapi.com/integrations/v1/limit/daily?hapikey=your_hapi_key>'
Note: Company I work for asked for an extension and our deadline is Feb 2023 thus I cannot check it myself.
